name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/api.js
api
description: Public framework API methods
examples: const framework = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework');

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/config/default.js
defaultConfig
description: Default config which is overridden by implementing party's config.

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/step_definitions/browser.js
browserStepDefs
description: Browser step definitions for use in feature files
examples: Given I navigate to "http://www.google.com"
When I navigate to "http://www.google.com"
When I get the browser title
When I switch to the window named "window1"
When I switch to the frame named "frame1"
When I go back in the browser
When I go forward in the browser

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/step_definitions/element.js
elementStepDefs
description: Element step definitions for use in feature files
examples: When I click the element with ID "my-id"
When I click the element with class "my-class"
When I click the element with tag "a"
When I click the element with name "my-name"
When I click the element with link text "My link"
When I click the element with partial link text "My li"
When I click the element with CSS selector ".my-class"
When I click the element with XPath "/html/body/article/p"
Then the element with ID "my-id" should exist
Then the element with class "my-class" should exist
Then the element with tag "a" should exist
Then the element with name "my-name" should exist
Then the element with link text "My link" should exist
Then the element with partial link text "My li" should exist
Then the element with CSS selector ".my-class" should exist
Then the element with XPath "/html/body/article/p" should exist

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/step_definitions/form.js
formStepDefs
description: Form step definitions for use in feature files
examples: When I input the text "my text" into the element with ID "my-id"
When I input the text "my text" into the element with class "my-class"
When I input the text "my text" into the element with tag "input"
When I input the text "my text" into the element with name "my-name"
When I input the text "my text" into the element with CSS selector ".my-form-field"
When I input the text "my text" into the element with XPath "/html/body/article/input"
Then the element with ID "my-id" has the value "my text"
Then the element with class "my-class" has the value "my text"
Then the element with tag "input" has the value "my text"
Then the element with name "my-name" has the value "my text"
Then the element with CSS selector ".my-form-field" has the value "my text"
Then the element with XPath "/html/body/article/input" has the value "my text"

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/step_definitions/text.js
textStepDefs
description: Text step definitions for use in feature files
examples: Then the element with ID "my-id" has the text "My text"
Then the element with class "my-class" has the text "My text"
Then the element with tag "a" has the text "My text"
Then the element with name "my-name" has the text "My text"
Then the element with link text "My link" has the text "My link"
Then the element with partial link text "My li" has the text "My link"
Then the element with CSS selector ".my-element" has the text "My text"
Then the element with XPath "/html/body/article/p" has the text "My text"

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/step_definitions/utility.js
utilityStepDefs
description: Utility step definitions for use in feature files
examples: When I sleep for "3000" milliseconds

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/browser.js
browserSupport
description: Browser supporting functions available for use in spec declarations
examples: const browserSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.browser;
browserSupport.getUrl.call(this, url).then()...; // go to a URL
browserSupport.getTitle.call(this).then()...; // get the browser's title
browserSupport.switchToWindow.call(this, "windowName").then()...; // switch to a window
browserSupport.switchToFrame.call(this, "frameName").then()...; // switch to a frame
browserSupport.goBack.call(this).then()...; // go back in the browser
browserSupport.goForward.call(this).then()...; // go forward in the browser

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/config.js
configSupport
description: Config bootstrapper

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/element.js
elementSupport
description: Element supporting functions available for use in spec declarations
examples: const elementSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.element;
elementSupport.find.call(this, { id: 'my-id '}).then((elem) => {... // find element using keyed object
elementSupport.findById.call(this, 'my-id').then((elem) => {... // find element by ID
elementSupport.findByClassName.call(this, 'my-class').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by class
elementSupport.findByTagName.call(this, 'a').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by tag name
elementSupport.findByName.call(this, 'my-name').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by name
elementSupport.findByLinkText.call(this, 'Link text').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by link text
elementSupport.findByPartialLinkText.call(this, 'Link te').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by partial link text
elementSupport.findByCss.call(this, '.my-selector').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by CSS selector
elementSupport.findByXPath.call(this, '/html/body/article/p').then((elem) => {... // find element/s by XPath

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/form.js
formSupport
description: Form supporting functions available for use in spec declarations
examples: const formSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.form;
formSupport.inputText.call(this, 'My text', elem); // input the text into an element
formSupport.submit.call(this, elem); // call the submit() method on the elem's closest form

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/text.js
textSupport
description: Text supporting functions available for use in spec declarations
examples: const textSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.text;
textSupport.getText.call(this, elem).then((text) => {... // get the innerText value of an element

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/utility.js
utilitySupport
description: Utility supporting functions available for use in spec declarations
examples: const utilitySupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.utility;
utilitySupport.wait.call(this, myConditionFunction, 3000); // wait 3s for myConditionFunction to pass - see http://www.seleniumhq.org/docs/03_webdriver.jsp
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedById.call(this, 'my-id', 3000); // wait 3s for element with ID to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByClassName.call(this, 'my-class', 3000); // wait 3s for element with class to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByTagName.call(this, 'a', 3000); // wait 3s for element with tag name to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByName.call(this, 'my-name', 3000); // wait 3s for element with name to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByLinkText.call(this, 'My link', 3000); // wait 3s for element with link text to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByPartialLinkText.call(this, 'My li', 3000); // wait 3s for element with partial link text to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByCss.call(this, '.my-class', 3000); // wait 3s for element with CSS selector to be located
utilitySupport.waitForElementLocatedByXPath.call(this, '/html/body/article/p', 3000); // wait 3s for element with XPath to be located
utilitySupport.sleep.call(this, 3000); // sleep the execution for 3s
utilitySupport.takeScreenshot.call(this).then((screenshotData) => { // take a screenshot (returns binary data which must be saved to disk)

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/features/support/world.js
world
description: World bootstrapper

name: amido-frontend-e2e-framework/index.js
AmidoFrontendE2EFramework
description:
AmidoFrontendE2EFramework
Public framework interface
All implementing parties should use the APIs provided by this interface and should *not* override them in their own code or package.json
examples: const seleniumWebDriver = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').seleniumWebDriver;
const chai = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').chai;
const api = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').api;
const browserSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.browser;
const elementSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.element;
const formSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.form;
const textSupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.text;
const utilitySupport = require('amido-frontend-e2e-framework').support.utility;
